job.title: Front End Cloud Software Developer
job.description: <p><strong>Candidate Requirements</strong></p><ul><li>Must be physically located in the United States</li><li>Must be a US Citizen or legally eligible to work in the US without requiring sponsorship</li><li>Must be fluent in written and verbal English</li><li>Minimum of 3 years of SFCC (Commerce Cloud) experience</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities - You will:</strong></p><ul><li>Produce excellent code while collaborating with internal development resources at the client.</li><li>Partner with other Red Vanners for QA, Project Management, and troubleshooting development issues.</li><li>Participate in stand-up meetings, conference calls, track your time, and work through tickets assigned to you within a Jira instance. Lots of tickets.</li><li>Work remotely with the distributed team at Red Van as well as client resources, being available during core business hours.</li><li>Act with urgency and professionalism when interfacing with client resources. Don’t worry, our Project Managers step in to handle the primary communication and resolve conflicts with clients.</li><li>Learn from some of the best on how to develop within the enterprise level e-commerce platform, Salesforce B2C Commerce Cloud.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Skills and Experience needed for success:</strong></p><ul><li>3-5 years minimum of experience with developing software and technical implementations of customer projects.</li><li>Experience building web applications, especially in the Node.js environment.</li><li>Experience with object-oriented languages and concepts, including development work using .NET, Javascript or other similar languages</li><li>Hands-on professional experience in designing, documenting and developing web-based and stand-alone software applications.</li><li>Strong understanding of Front end and Back end web development.</li><li>Some experience evaluating and implementing cloud-based solutions</li><li>Excellent communication skills and a demonstrated ability to work independently.</li><li>Possess analytical, problem-solving, teamwork and communication skills as well as creativity and attention to detail; familiarity with database management, development environment, program testing, and other related software.</li><li>Appreciation for web standards and accessibility (e.g. WCAG Standards, screenreader support, semantic HTML).</li><li>Excitement to play a critical and evolving role in driving technical initiatives to enhance end-user and developer experiences.</li><li>Experienced working with designers to create and maintain style guides &amp; CSS standards across different applications.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Compensation:</strong></p><ul><li>$90,000, - $120,000 annually</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Perks and Benefits:</strong></p><ul><li>Work fully remote within the US</li><li>Comprehensive benefits and health coverage</li><li>Annual bonus</li><li>Paid vacation, sick leave, and time off to volunteer</li><li>Paid leave for new parents</li><li>We invest in your future by contributing 3% of your salary to a 401(K), even if you don't</li><li>Recurring stipend to upgrade your home office and equipment</li></ul><p></p>
